file_content.text: We'll have the domination experiments running again in no time.
Yes, Kazzak Hurn has just made contact with us. His gang is eager for revenge, and those who remain are extremely loyal.
We'll have the experiments up and running again in no time.
The Empire--no, I cannot thank you enough for your help.
Eliminate the Fire-eater rebels.
The Fire-eater lieutenants are free.
Yes, so I've heard. Excellent news. Except for one small complication.
Kazzak Hurn's control over his Fire-eaters wasn't as strong as we presumed. A faction has rebelled and is attacking Kazzak's forces.
The Fire-eaters are no use to us if they wipe each other out.
I'll handle it.
I knew I could count on you to take the initiative.
Are we sure we want these guys for the domination experiments?
Are they worth the trouble?
Believe it or not, their vicious unpredictability is an asset.
Good luck with that.
I hate to ask another thing of you, but I want our full weight behind Kazzak Hurn. The rebelling Gamorreans must be defeated.
Of course.
I'll see what I can do.
Thank you very much. You are a credit to the Empire.
I'm done here. [Refuse quest]
Darth Fastus is not going to be happy to hear this.
We must free the Fire-eater lieutenants to get their support.
Hunter. I have a commission for you, if you have time to give the Empire.
Agent. Your Empire calls on you once more.
My lord. The Empire cannot survive without the strength of the Sith to rest on.
The Empire requires aid. Are you up for it?
I'm sure you've heard of the Republic's so-called "domination experiments"? Alien pitted against alien, to see who's the strongest?
The experiments collapsed when the prison break started and the aliens scattered, but the esteemed Darth Fastus has sent me to resume the trials.
What is Darth Fastus's interest in the domination trials?
Why restart them?
What exactly were the "domination experiments"?
Explain these trials.
They were tests of combat, designed to identify the strengths of alien species and exploit them. Unusual for the Republic.
I don't care.
Darth Fastus wants to gather enough aliens to resume and improve the experiments, using genetic modification to create the perfect alien fighters.
Problem is, the freed aliens have split into gangs, and they're not fond of the idea of being experimented on.
If they're not saying "yes," then you're not asking right.
They don't get to choose.
I get the feeling the subjects of the experiments don't get as much of a thrill out of it as the observers.
I can see that.
Is that why you want me?
I said the aliens weren't fond of the experiments. That was only mostly true. We had one group interested. Gamorrean gang. The Fire-eaters.
Their leader, Kazzak Hurn, had agreed to help round up the other aliens when the other gangs joined against him and captured his lieutenants.
We can't restart the experiments without his help, and he won't help unless his lieutenants are freed. Want to go show some aliens the Empire's power?
Absolutely.
I suppose.
Appreciate it. I simply don't have the manpower to take on all these gangs.
Kazzak Hurn's lieutenants are scattered throughout the old experiment grounds. They will be under heavy guard, so be careful.
No. [Refuse quest]
I hope you'll reconsider. Darth Fastus is a powerful man. He rewards his allies generously.
So much work yet to do.
